_header: Solomon sayeth there is none accord
Note:
Formerly duplicated in Robbins and Cutler (1965)
XRossell Hope Robbins, and John L. Cutler. Supplement to the Index of Middle English Verse. Lexington, Kentucky: University of Kentucky Press, 1965 by 3068.5; lines 25-26 same as lines 1-2 of 6621.7 and includes lines corresponding to 3162, 6594.
_description: Proverbs in English — thirty lines in couplets

CamTCC1450.First Lines:
Salamon seyth ther is none accordeTher euery man wuld be a
                    lord…
CamTCC1450.Last Lines:
…Grace passyth golde and precyous stoneGod schall be god when
                    golde is gone
